meanings.definition: To approve, support, or recommend publicly.
meanings.sent1: The mayor was endorsing the new recycling program in his speech.
meanings.sent2: Many customers trust the brand after seeing celebrities endorsing it.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot was endorsing the idea of more treats for everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was endorsing the message of kindness and positivity.
meanings.sent5: The loud applause was endorsing the performer's talent and hard work.

meanings.definition: To sign one's name on the back of a check or other document to show approval or transfer of ownership.
meanings.sent1: She was endorsing the check before depositing it at the bank.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer endorsed the contract to finalize the deal.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be endorsing the adoption papers with a paw print.
meanings.sent4: His signature was endorsing the historical document for authenticity.
meanings.sent5: The fingerprint was endorsing the agreement in a unique way.
